>>49662733
They don't have employee contracts, they are treated like independent contractors, and this is a standard for the whole industry.

>>49662838
That makes Wactor even blacker, even Niji and Holos confirmed they have contracts.

>>49662838
For outsourcing contracts is the same if not more stricter with employers. Japan carbon copied progressive laws from countries like Germany, England and Spain.

>>49662913
Holo and Niji do have contracts but they're not in a employer-employee relationship. They like more hired consultants.

>>49662980
That's not true at all, they have to change their contracts after many shitstorms, at least Cover, i don't know if Riku did it, probably to EN and JP branchs, because for consultant contracts they shouldn't be so strict as they are, just get any consultant contact in the internet.

>>49663094
Well I'm speaking with 2021 knowledge so you may be right, things change a lot.
But there's another thing.
When you give employee contracts in Japan, their work laws make it extremely difficult to fire people, and Niji lays out/terminates people like it's nothing. That's only possible with contractor deals.

>>49663261
That's probably because on how the contract is done more than the type of employee you have, because, even if it's consultant, part-time or something, the contract and the legal laws are the same in JP. Is on how an employee can breach the contract the important thing, probably Niji is on the thin-line of what's legal, and wactor is just african-tier black contract. The fact that they have to resort to doxx instead of a real legal push speak volumes.
